alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 3:31PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern McIntosh, southern Okmulgee and eastern Okfuskee Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Wetumka to 5 miles south of Henryetta. Movement was north at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Hoffman... Clearview... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... Bryant... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 220 and 245. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
